heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

nearest_lightning.status: The closest strike happened on 13 May 2025, a distance of just 4.97 miles away.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 12 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: This period, starting 09 September 2025, is ranked 11th among the longest rainy periods since 23 September 2024.  It has lasted 5 days so far.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 6 cold snaps, usually there are 3.7 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not an active heatwaves.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was 18 July 2025, there have been only 62 tropical nights since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (198°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: 1754 miles is the largest wind run recorded on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.5 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (down 0.3 mm), cloud levels (up 570 m), feels like temperature (up 3.6°C), and outside temperature (up 2.4°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 87.1m lower than yesterday, 130.5m lower than the past week, 570.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 939m and a high of 3180m, averaging 1699.2m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.
cloud levels.summary: The sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; you can expect comfortable, mild temperatures. Also, air will feel comfortable and balanced and very little to no wind will be present. Light to moderate rain is forecast, the sky’s high clouds will permit plenty of sunshine, and some sunny spells will occur. The weather may change rapidly and become worse.
